intro: Rubus purpuratus subsp. brachyandroides, commonly known as the short-stemmed blackberry, is a shrub native to the Pacific Northwest of the United States. It is characterized by its dense, thorny stems and compound leaves with three leaflets. The plant produces small, aggregate fruits known as berries, which are typically dark purple to black in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or riparian habitats. This subspecies is valued for its edible fruits and its role in local ecosystems.
